translation.text: https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/ems-29489
You may need to change trains at Granville to continue your journey
Tuesday 12 and Wednesday 13 March Nightly from 11 50 PM to 1 30 AM, some trains run to a changed timetable between Richmond or Leppington and Olympic Park only. Some trains end at Granville.

Tuesday 12 and Wednesday 13 March   
  • Nightly from 11.50pm to 1.30am, some trains run to a changed timetable between Richmond or Leppington and Olympic Park only. Some trains end at Granville.
  • You may need to change trains at Granville to continue your journey.

  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/ems-29525
Buses replace trains between Port Kembla and Wollongong
Thursday 14 March From 9 20 AM to 2 15 PM, buses replace trains between Port Kembla and Wollongong.

Thursday 14 March
  • From 9.20am to 2.15pm, buses replace trains between Port Kembla and Wollongong.
  • Buses towards Wollongong may leave stations up to 15 minutes earlier than the normal train timetable.
  • Trains run between Wollongong and Thirroul or Waterfall to the normal timetable.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus route
27SC  Port Kembla, then all stations to Wollongong and return
https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/ems-29465
City Circle: Trains will not run to Museum, St James or Circular Quay
Monday 11 to Thursday 14 March Nightly from 10 PM to 1 30 AM, trains will not run to Museum, St James or Circular Quay.

Monday 11 to Thursday 14 March
  • Nightly from 10pm to 1.30am, trains will not run to Museum, St James or Circular Quay.
  • T2 Leppington, T3 Bankstown and T8 Airport & South Line trains start and end at Central.
  • T1 North Shore & Western and T9 Northern Line trains continue to run between Central, Town Hall and Wynyard.
  • T4 Eastern Suburbs Line trains continue to run between Central, Town Hall, Martin Place and Kings Cross.
  • The light rail runs in both directions between Circular Quay and Central.
  • If you are travelling to:
    • Circular Quay, change at Wynyard for the light rail or walk
    • Museum or St James, change at Central or Town Hall for local buses or walk

  • Other lines are also affected by this work. Please check details before you travel.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/ems-29472
T1 Western Line: Some trains make an extra stop at Ashfield
Monday 11 to Thursday 14 March Nightly from 10 PM to 1 30 AM, some trains make an extra stop at Ashfield.

Monday 11 to Thursday 14 March
  • Nightly from 10pm to 1.30am, some trains make an extra stop at Ashfield.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/ems-29479
Trains run to a changed timetable and stopping pattern
Monday 11 to Thursday 14 March Nightly, Leppington trains run to a changed timetable between Leppington and Central

Monday 11 to Thursday 14 March
  • Nightly from 9.40pm to 1.30am, Leppington trains run to a changed timetable between Leppington and Central, platforms 1-12, via Granville, and will not stop at Ashfield. Some T1 and T9 trains make an extra stop at Ashfield.
  • Inner West trains run to a changed timetable between Homebush and North Sydney due to trackwork on the City Circle.

  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/ems-29493

https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/ems-29483
Buses replace some trains
Friday 15 March Buses replace the 12 30 AM Central to Liverpool service from Sydenham to Liverpool, and the 12 52 AM Lidcombe to Bankstown service.

Friday 15 March  
  • Buses replace the 00:30 Central to Liverpool service from Sydenham to Liverpool, and the 00:52 Lidcombe to Bankstown service.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
8T3   Lidcombe, then all stations to Bankstown – one direction only
17T3 Sydenham, then all stations to Liverpool – one direction only
https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/ems-29475

Leppington trains will not stop at Ashfield
Saturday 16 March From 6 30 AM to 10 30 AM, Leppington trains will not stop at Ashfield. You may need to change at Strathfield to continue your journey..

Saturday 16 March 
  • From 11.30pm to 2.20am, buses replace trains between Waterfall and Hurstville.
  • Trains run between South Coast Line stations and Waterfall only.
  • T4 Illawarra Line trains run between Hurstville and Bondi Junction, some to a changed timetable.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.

City Circle: Trains run in one direction only, from Central first stop Town Hall
Sunday 17 March Trains run in one direction only, from Central first stop Town Hall.

Sunday 17 March
  • Trains run in one direction only, from Central first stop Town Hall.
  • Trains may start or end at Central, run to a changed timetable or leave from different platforms.
  • You may need to change trains to continue your journey.
  • The light rail runs in both directions between Circular Quay and Central.

  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/ems-29469
T1 North Shore Line: Buses replace trains between North Sydney and Wynyard
Sunday 17 March Buses replace trains between North Sydney and Wynyard.

Sunday 17 March
  • Buses replace trains between North Sydney and Wynyard.
  • From Wynyard, City Circle trains run in one direction only, first stop Circular Quay.
  • The light rail runs in both directions between Wynyard and Circular Quay or Central.
  • Trains run between Berowra and North Sydney, some to a changed timetable.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.

T1 Western Line: Buses replace trains between Emu Plains and Blacktown
Saturday 16 and Sunday 17 March Buses replace trains between Emu Plains and Blacktown.

Saturday 16 and Sunday 17 March 
  • Buses replace trains between Emu Plains and Blacktown.

  • Saturday, trains run to a changed timetable between Richmond, Blacktown and the City.

  • Sunday, trains run between Blacktown and Central, platforms 1-12 only.
  • Richmond trains run between Richmond and Olympic Park. Change at Parramatta to continue your journey towards the City.
  • From 6.30am to 10.30am, Richmond trains run between Richmond and Strathfield.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
70T1 Mount Druitt to Blacktown then return (time limited)
71T1 Penrith, then express to Blacktown and return
72T1 Penrith, then all stations to Blacktown and return
1ABM Springwood, then all stations to Penrith and return

Trains start and end at Redfern
Sunday 17 March Trains run between Liverpool or Lidcombe and Redfern only.

Sunday 17 March
  • Trains run between Liverpool or Lidcombe and Redfern only.
  • If travelling to the City you can change at:
    • Sydenham for a T4 Eastern Suburbs & Illawarra Line train
    • Redfern for a train to City Circle stations

  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/ems-29487
Buses replace trains between Cronulla and Sutherland, and some trains between Waterfall and Hurstville
Saturday 16 and Sunday 17 March Buses replace trains between Cronulla and Sutherland.

Saturday 16 and Sunday 17 March    
  • Buses replace trains between Cronulla and Sutherland.
  • Trains run between Waterfall, Sutherland and Bondi Junction, some to a changed timetable.

  • Saturday from 11.30pm to 2.20am, buses also replace trains between Waterfall and Hurstville.
  • Trains run between Hurstville and Bondi Junction, some to a changed timetable.

  • Sunday, some trains make extra stops at St Peters and Erskineville.
  • From 8am to 8pm, extra trains run between Hurstville and Bondi Junction.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.

42T4 Hurstville, then Sutherland, then all stations to Cronulla and return
43T4 Hurstville, then all stations to Sutherland and return and return

Trains run to a changed timetable and stopping pattern
Sunday 17 March Trains run to a changed timetable and stopping pattern. You may need to change trains to continue your journey.

Sunday 17 March
  • Trains run to a changed timetable and stopping pattern. You may need to change trains to continue your journey.
  • Revesby trains run between Revesby and Central only.
  • Most Macarthur trains to the City run via Sydenham. Trains from the City run via the Airport.
  • Early morning and late evening trains run via the Airport but start and end at Central, platform 23.

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/ems-29497
Trains run between Hornsby and Central, platforms 1-12 only
Sunday 17 March Trains run between Hornsby and Central, platforms 1 to 12 only.

Sunday 17 March
  • Trains run between Hornsby and Central, platforms 1-12 only.
  • Change at Central for a City Circle train or the light rail to continue your journey.

  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/ems-29516
Buses replace trains between Bathurst and Blacktown
Saturday 16 and Sunday 17 March Buses replace trains between Bathurst and Blacktown.

Saturday 16 and Sunday 17 March   
  • Buses replace trains between Bathurst and Blacktown.
  • T1 Western Line trains run between Blacktown and Central, to a changed timetable.

  • If you are travelling to Lithgow to connect with NSW TrainLink Regional Coaches, please call 132 232 to confirm departure times.

  • Warrimoo Station: The footbridge will be closed. A shuttle bus service will run between the Great Western Highway and Railway Parade. Please allow extra time.  

  • Replacement buses may be impacted by driver shortages. We are doing all we can to minimise the impact to your journey and provide a safe service, however cancellations or delays may occur.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information. You can also subscribe to planned trackwork alerts.
Bus routes
1ABM Springwood, then all stations to Penrith and return
2BM Bathurst, then express to Lithgow and return
4BM Katoomba, then all stations to Blaxland, then express to Blacktown and return
10BM Bathurst, then Tarana, Rydal, Lithgow and return
17BM Bathurst, Lithgow, Mt Victoria, Katoomba, Springwood, Penrith then Blacktown and return
53BM Lithgow, then all stations to Katoomba, Springwood, Blaxland, Blacktown and return
56BM Mount Victoria, then all stations to Katoomba, Springwood, Blaxland, Blacktown and return
96BM Warrimoo Station Shuttle - Great Western Highway to Railway Parade and return

Monday 18 to Thursday 21 March

T2 Leppington, T3 Bankstown and T8 Airport & South Line trains start and end at Central.
T1 North Shore & Western, T2 Inner West and T9 Northern Line trains continue to run between Central and Wynyard.
T4 Eastern Suburbs Line trains continue to run between Central, Town Hall, Martin Place and Kings Cross.
The light rail runs in both directions between Circular Quay and Central.
If you are travelling to: Circular Quay, change at Wynyard for the light rail or walk
Museum or St James, change at Central or Town Hall for local buses or walk

Wednesday from 11PM to 1:30AM, buses replace Inner West trains between Strathfield and Ashfield.

Most T1 Western Line trains make extra stops at Homebush and Burwood.

Special Events - Wednesday 13 March

NSW Premiers Gala Concerts - ICC Sydney Theatre, Darling Harbour
Morning concert 11:00 to 12:45
Afternoon concert 14:45 to 16:30
- The best station for connections to the venue is Central. Trains run regularly to Central and additional NSW TrainLink services will also run.
- From Central, catch L1 Light rail services leaving from the Grand Concourse to the Exhibition Centre stop which is directly opposite the venue.
- Shuttle buses will run to supplement light rail services between Central and Exhibition Centre each day as needed.

Fred again - Qudos Bank Arena, Sydney Olympic Park
19:30 to 22:50
- The closest station to the Arena is Olympic Park.
- Trains run regularly to Lidcombe where you can head to Platform Zero for a direct train to Olympic Park, running every 10 minutes until late.

For details, please visit https://transportnsw.info/events/2024/3
